column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The AIC is the best art museum in America's heartland
column2: bar none.  The collection is diverse but timelessly classic.  As other Yelpers have suggested
column3: do not miss the Picasso.  There's a small gallery filled with some of the better Monets as well.  The sculpture is generally quite strong as well.  The museum is quite cavernous
column4: so be prepared to get yourself wonderfully lost.  Check out the free days (when it is obviously really crowded) and the student discounts!
